thread.title: Autumn celebrated as villagers toast their apple harvest
thread.title_full: Autumn celebrated as villagers toast their apple harvest

author: Somerset Guardian
title: Autumn celebrated as villagers toast their apple harvest
text:
Autumn celebrated as villagers toast their apple harvest By Somerset Guardian | Posted: October 25, 2015 Maggie Horrill with a basket of apples BAPG20151017F005_C VIEW GALLERY Autumn celebrated as villagers toast their apple harvest X 
Copy link to paste in your message / Maggie Horrill with a basket of apples BAPG20151017F005_C Martin Horler on the apple press BAPG20151017F020_C Everything apples, grower Fergus Callander BAPG20151017F017_C Audrey Riley from Kilmersdon WI BAPG20151017F002_C Steve Wood with the cider Picture: Paul Gillis/ paulgillisphoto.com BAPG20151017F003_C Jane McIntyre, right, and Dot Smith BAPG20151017F021_C 
An event celebrating autumn and its harvest was staged at Kilmersdon Village Hall. 
Apple day has become an annual event organised by the village hall management committee for local families. 
People are encouraged to bring along their apples to be juiced and apple-orientated competitions are organised such as who can make the longest peel, guess the weight of the apple and pin the maggot on the apple. 
A contest to make the tastiest apple muffins to a specific recipe is a popular event. Refreshments including cider and apple juice were available on Saturday and Kilmersdon-based musicians the Village Band provided the entertainment.
